entry.title: Moscow official accuses Armenia of ‚Äúdiving into absurdity‚Äù

media:group.media:title: Moscow official accuses Armenia of ‚Äúdiving into absurdity‚Äù
media:group.media:description:
üìçUS Assistant Secretary of State James O‚ÄôBrien encourages Armenian and Azerbaijani governments to "deliver more for their people" by concluding a peace agreement, while Azerbaijan snubs visit by U.S. Caucasus Negotiator Louis Bono. üìçThe 2024 Human Rights Watch World Report cites concern over Nagorno-Karabakh aftermath, Azerbaijan's dismissal of ICJ interim measure rulings, skirmished in the region and on the Armenian border, as well as Baku‚Äôs prosecution of government critics, lack of freedoms, and torture. üìçRussian Foreign Ministry denies ethnic cleansing in Nagorno-Karabakh or that that peacekeepers failed in their job, warns Armenia about getting close to the West. üìçYerevan municipality plans to remove decades-old tennis courts for Ring Park renovation. Link to video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=26oriiLaS9U

entry.title: Aliyev revives demand for extraterritorial corridor through Syunik

media:group.media:title: Aliyev revives demand for extraterritorial corridor through Syunik
media:group.media:description:
üìçAliyev demands Armenia allow the establishment of an extra-territorial corridor across Syunik or else he will keep Armenia blockaded forever. üìçThe Armenian government will provide a loan of approximately 8.5 million dollars for the metallurgical plant project being relocated from the border village of Yeraskh. üìçSecurity Council Secretary Armen Grigoryan to participate in Ukrainian peace forum which Moscow has called "a blatantly anti-Russian events" üìçBombshell report in New Lines Magazine suggests Azerbaijan may have been building a concentration camp in Aghdam as part of its plan to take over Nagorno-Karabakh. üìçOur latest podcast episode with guest Erik Yeghyan about his transition from soldier to winemaker, and Armenia's ambitions for the sector. Link: https://youtu.be/on8o-2hmu-w

entry.title: From Frontlines to Vineyards: A Veteran's Transition into Winemaking

media:group.media:title: From Frontlines to Vineyards: A Veteran's Transition into Winemaking
media:group.media:description:
In this episode of the Civilnet Podcast, host Patrick Elliott speaks with Erik Yeghyan, a combat veteran of the Karabakh war who transitioned to winemaking after his military service. They discuss Yeghyan's experience on the frontlines defending Artsakh and what drove him to return home to work in Armenia's burgeoning wine industry. Elliott and Yeghyan explore how Armenian winemakers are reviving ancient grape varieties and traditions to create world-class wines and boost the country's reputation in the global market.

entry.title: What type of leadership is required to help heal nations? #shorts

media:group.media:title: What type of leadership is required to help heal nations? #shorts
media:group.media:description:
In this episode, we explore the life of Armen Kherlopian, Ph.D., a scientist, researcher, angel investor, and advisor to the board of several prominent corporations. We discuss the relevance of artificial intelligence, data sciences, and innovations for tomorrow. With a background in biomedical engineering and biophysics, we assess how Dr. Kherlopian entered the world of entrepreneurship, investments, and startups and how he makes sense of a world increasingly dependent on machine learning. Finally, we explore Dr. Kherlopian‚Äôs historical and family legacies from Aintab and Marash, which have been pivotal in his successes and mission to push boundaries in tech and sciences and contribute to the betterment of our world. Watch full interview: https://youtu.be/j6kQD8148TQ

entry.title: Greek Foreign Minister announces aid for those forcibly displaced from Karabakh

media:group.media:title: Greek Foreign Minister announces aid for those forcibly displaced from Karabakh
media:group.media:description:
üìçIn Yerevan, Greek Foreign Minister conveys support for Armenia‚Äôs EU aspirations, a UNESCO fact finding mission for Christian sites in Nagorno-Karabakh, and promises aid to its displaced population. üìçThe World Bank expects Armenia's GDP to grow by 4.7% in 2024, and estimates it grew 7.1% in 2023. üìçBarrier placed by developer of Cow‚Äôs Garden property removes barrier after pressure from local activists, and also removes the last bulldozer on site. üìçNew footage of Armenia‚Äôs iconic bezoar goats at this link: https://www.facebook.com/CivilNet.TV/videos/342250355339830
